page.title: 07Fish Processing,Fraserburgh.
page.content: When we went to a factory they told us that when the fish comes from the market they are kept cold until the filleters can fillet the fish.There are 10 boxes of fish on a palet.There are 100 fish in a box. When the fish are filleted the bones are kept.They are put in plate freezers and they are taken to be made into dog food.One man was making a pickle with salt and water.The English people like colouring but Scots don't. If the fish are not kept cool they go bad.It is Â£30 for a box of fish.They have to buy 15,000 boxes of fish a week. There is a grading machine.It has an electronic eye that says to one of the pushers to push,and it pushes the fish into the box.They employ 72 people.The cold store is -40 degrees and all the fish are kept in there.
